To be considered as Russian and to receive 'bonuses' from the state, products must accumulate more than 50 points."

  "english": "Novo Nordisk is testing a new obesity drug for children called CagriSema. The Danish pharmaceutical company begins trials of the compound, which combines cagrilintide and semaglutine, against pediatric obesity. The researchers will monitor changes in body mass index of children over the first 68 weeks and then for three years. Results are expected not earlier than in 2030. Pediatric obesity is a serious and global issue, described as an epidemic by experts. In Russia, the overall incidence of obesity among children under 15 years old increased by 36.1% from 2018 to 2024, according to Mikhail Murashko."

The coverage of HPV vaccines is only at 5%. 'Nanolec' promises to release its vaccine into the civil market in the second half of 2026. Currently, only individual regions purchase vaccines on their own budget. The financing for vaccine prevention is considered insufficient by 60% of experts, and knowledge about vaccination remains inadequate among patients as well as doctors."

  "english": "The allergy to birch pollen vaccine has moved into the third phase of clinical trials. The transparency of decision-making processes is questioned, especially when drugs are initially included in lists and then withdrawn. 'Infarma' suggests several measures to make the commission's activities transparent for all participants: public organizations should have additional oversight over results, experts should be able to deeply examine proposed drugs; the process should be divided into stages such as clinical evaluation and economic assessment.   "impact": "high",
  "english": "The government has assigned the testing of drugs on a 'chip person'. The Russian government, by decree, approved a task to create a system for screening drugs using the 'chip person' model. The technology allows for quickly and effectively testing a multitude of biological and chemical substances on cell cultures that mimic human organ function to identify the most promising compounds for further development of new drugs. This approach will help reduce animal testing and move away from traditional test tubes by creating a more favorable environment, as conventional tests on individual cultures cannot assess the impact of a drug on an entire organ or even the whole body. The model is included in the program for developing genetic technologies over the next few years. Initial work in this area has already been done ‚Äî in summer, at the Pulmonary Institute of the Far Eastern Federal University (FEFU), a 'light chip' was created. Additionally, systems for liver and kidney have been developed at the Siberian State Medical University (SibG–úU) as part of the 'Priority-2030' program. "

  "english": "American researchers conducted a study to understand the antivaccination movement. They surveyed 1046 parents (parents of 1701 children) using an anonymous online questionnaire PACV, which assessed attitudes towards vaccination safety and effectiveness. The results show that 85% of participants have a positive attitude towards vaccines, while 15% are negative. The study highlights the role of parents in making healthcare decisions and emphasizes the importance of trust in doctors for effective communication. Key factors influencing vaccine acceptance include employment, medical staff presence, and proximity to the city."

However, the difference between glitazones and sulfonylureas was not statistically significant. The study concluded that there is no statistically significant difference between glitazones and sulfonylureas, but a difference exists between gliptins and sulfonylureas."

Widely criticized preventive recommendations for D3 by the American Society of Endocrinology contradict other recommendations, 3. A lot of design options for recommendation designs and guidelines. The doctor simply sees no point in joining the debate on the rationality of D3 supplementation against a crowd of space claimers. Note: Almost all milk in the USA is 'fortified' with D3, like our iodine - salt. Comment on who supports vitamin D and who opposes."

It also reduces levels of IL-1, FNOŒ± and HMGB1, while increasing the production of anti-inflammatory cytokines IL-10 and VEGF. This action reduces the consequences of systemic hyperimmunological response, which lies at the basis of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), including in cases of COVID-19. The drug has been included in the clinical guidelines of Russia's Ministry of Health and on the list of essential medicines. "

{

  "topic": "clinical_case, shortage, safety",
  "impact": "high",
  "english": "A case study on rhabdomyolysis associated with rosuvastatin. The patient, an 83-year-old polymorbid woman (myocardial infarction and chronic kidney disease), experienced progressive weakness, pain in her arms and legs, and bruises on her body after discontinuing rosuvastatin. Elevated CK and CK-MB levels, toxic hepatitis, and acute kidney injury were detected upon admission. The case was evaluated for possible causes of rhabdomyolysis, ruling out other potential factors. The case was further evaluated for systemic connective tissue diseases and genetic associations, but no specific cause was identified. The case highlights the need for a diagnostic algorithm and follow-up on patient status."
}

{

  "country": "global",
  "topic": "clinical_trial, safety",
  "impact": "high",
  "english": "The publication in JAMA Ophthalmology (June 2025) indicates that semaglutide (Ozempic, Wegovy) doubles the risk of neovascular age-related macular degeneration (nAMD) in elderly patients with diabetes. The study found that the risk of nAMD was 2.2 times higher among patients over 66 years old who have been on GLP-1 RA for more than 6 months. The risk increases to 3.6 times higher when the treatment duration exceeds 30 months. This is particularly concerning for elderly patients with diabetes, especially those who are older and have a history of stroke. The findings add significant signals regarding the risk of nAMD with GLP-1 RA therapy, and patients on these medications need to be closely monitored by ophthalmologists even without complaints of vision problems. Endocrinologists and ophthalmologists need to collaborate in managing these patients."
}

{
  "skip": false,
  "country": "global",
  "topic": "regulation, safety, clinical_trial",
  "impact": "high",
  "english": "EMA completed the evaluation of drugs containing semaglutide after reports of a rare eye condition - acute ischemic optic neuropathy (NAION). This can cause partial vision loss, usually unilateral. The committee concluded that NAION is a very rare side effect of semaglutide (occurring in 1 out of every 10,000 people). The risk is slightly higher among patients with type 2 diabetes - about twice as high compared to those not taking the drug. This aligns with an additional case per 10,000 person-years of treatment. It is noted that this neuropathy can develop even in patients with diabetes, especially those older than 50 years. Now a warning about this risk has been added to the drug's instructions. If sudden vision loss or rapid vision deterioration occurs during semaglutide treatment, patients should seek immediate medical attention. In case of confirmed NAION, drug use should be discontinued."
}
